title: Mark Conway
text:
Mark Conway (born 31 January 1964) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. He played at representative level for Yorkshire Under-13s, Yorkshire Under-16s, Yorkshire Colts (Under-19s), England Schools Under-16s, Great Britain Colts (Under-19s, including the first ever Colts tour to Australia, and Papua New Guinea in 1982), and Great Britain Under-21s, and at club level for <a href="Stanley%20Rangers">Stanley Rangers</a> ARLFC, <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Leeds%20Rhinos%20players">Heritage No. 1116</a>), <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage No. 995</a>) (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> and <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster Dragons</a> (Heritage No.) for <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a> <a href="Colin%20Maskill">Colin Maskill</a>, as a , i.e. number 7, and occasionally , i.e. number 6. As of 2017, he still holds Wakefield Trinity's 'most goals in a match' record with 13-<a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s scored in the 90–12 victory over <a href="Liverpool%20Stanley%23Highfield%20%E2%80%93%201991%E2%80%931996">Highfield</a> during the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1992–93</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">Regal Trophy</a> <a href="tournament">preliminary round</a> during the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1992–93 season</a> at <a href="Belle%20Vue%20%28Wakefield%29">Belle Vue</a>, <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a>, on Tuesday 27 October 1992.
Playing career.
County Cup Final appearances.
Mark Conway played in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 8–11 defeat by <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> in the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1990–91</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1990–91 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Sunday 23 September 1990.
Notable tour matches.
Mark Conway played , and scored 2-<a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 4–31 defeat by <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> in the <a href="1982%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1982 Kangaroo tour of Great Britain and France</a> match at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Wednesday 20 October 1982, played in the 10–16 defeat by <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in the <a href="1985%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1985 New Zealand rugby league tour of Great Britain and France</a> match at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Tuesday 29 October 1985, and played , and scored 3-<a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 18–36 defeat by <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> in the <a href="1990%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1990 Kangaroo tour of Great Britain and France</a> match at <a href="Belle%20Vue%20%28Wakefield%29">Belle Vue</a> <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> on Wednesday 10 October 1990.
Club career.
Mark Conway played , and he made his début in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' victory over <a href="Bramley%20RLFC">Bramley</a> in the <a href="Lazenby%20Cup">Lazenby Cup</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a> in 1981, that was to be his only appearance in the starting line-up during the <a href="1981%E2%80%9382%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1981–82 season</a> as the understudy to <a href="Kevin%20Dick">Kevin Dick</a>, Conway spent five seasons with <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> competing with <a href="Kevin%20Dick">Kevin Dick</a> and <a href="Cliff%20Lyons">Cliff Lyons</a> for the position, and he produced a number of memorable performances in cup ties.
In August 1987, the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> players; Mark Conway, <a href="Phil%20Fox%20%28rugby%20league%29">Phil</a> <a href="Philip%20Fox%20%28rugby%20league%29">ip Fox</a>, <a href="Andrew%20Mason%20%28rugby%20league%29">Andy Mason</a> and <a href="Keith%20Rayne">Keith Rayne</a>, were transferred in exchange for the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> players; <a href="John%20Lyons%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Lyons</a>, and <a href="Gary%20Spencer">Gary Spencer</a>.
Mark Conway is sixth on the all-time Wakefield Trinity goal kicking list, and fourth on the all-time Wakefield Trinity points scoring list.
Outside of Rugby League.
Mark was a pupil at Newton Hill Junior School, and <a href="Outwood%20Grange%20Academy">Outwood Grange School</a>, and is a former <a href="coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a> at <a href="Stanley%20Rangers">Stanley Rangers</a> ARLFC, and as of 2017 he is a <a href="Franchising">franchise</a> sales director at 9ROUND Fitness UK. He has a daughter Danielle, (born ), and a son Matt, (born ).
